t: Matthew 15
The Tradition of the Elders
Then*p Jesus was approached by Pharisees and scribes from Jerusalem, who asked,
“Why do your disciples break the tradition of the elders? For they don’t wash their hands when they eat.”
He*p answered them, “Why*r do*r you*r break*r God’s*r commandment*r because*r of*r your*r tradition?*r
For*r God*r said:*r Honor*ir your*ir father*ir and*ir your*ir mother;*ir and,*r Whoever*ir speaks*ir evil*ir of*ir father*ir or*ir mother*ir must*ir be*ir put*ir to*ir death.*ir
But*r you*r say,*r ‘Whoever*r tells*r his*r father*r or*r mother,*r “Whatever*r benefit*r you*r might*r have*r received*r from*r me*r is*r a*r gift*r committed*r to*r the*r temple,”*r
he*r does*r not*r have*r to*r honor*r his*r father.’*r In*r this*r way,*r you*r have*r nullified*r the*r word*r of*r God*r because*r of*r your*r tradition.*r
Hypocrites!*r Isaiah*r prophesied*r correctly*r about*r you*r when*r he*r said:*r
This*irpn people*ir honors*ir me*ir with*ir their*ir lips,*ir but*irln their*ir heart*ir is*ir far*ir from*ir me.*ir
They*irln worship*ir me*ir in*ir vain,*ir teaching*irln as*ir doctrines*ir human*ir commands.”*ir
Defilement Is from Within
Summoning*p the crowd, he told them, “Listen*r and*r understand:*r
It’s*r not*r what*r goes*r into*r the*r mouth*r that*r defiles*r a*r person,*r but*r what*r comes*r out*r of*r the*r mouth -*r this*r defiles*r a*r person.”*r
Then*p the disciples came up and told him, “Do you know that the Pharisees took offense when they heard what you said?”
He*p replied, “Every*r plant*r that*r my*r heavenly*r Father*r didn’t*r plant*r will*r be*r uprooted.*r
Leave*r them*r alone!*r They*r are*r blind*r guides.*r And*r if*r the*r blind*r guide*r the*r blind,*r both*r will*r fall*r into*r a*r pit.”*r
Then*p Peter said, “Explain this parable to us.”
“Do*rp you*r still*r lack*r understanding?”*r he asked.
“Don’t*r you*r realize*r that*r whatever*r goes*r into*r the*r mouth*r passes*r into*r the*r stomach*r and*r is*r eliminated?*r
But*r what*r comes*r out*r of*r the*r mouth*r comes*r from*r the*r heart,*r and*r this*r defiles*r a*r person.*r
For*r from*r the*r heart*r come*r evil*r thoughts,*r murders,*r adulteries,*r sexual*r immoralities,*r thefts,*r false*r testimonies,*r slander.*r
These*r are*r the*r things*r that*r defile*r a*r person;*r but*r eating*r with*r unwashed*r hands*r does*r not*r defile*r a*r person.”*r
A Gentile Mother’s Faith
When*p Jesus left there, he withdrew to the area of Tyre and Sidon.
Just then a Canaanite woman from that region came and kept crying out, “Have mercy on me, Lord, Son of David! My daughter is severely tormented by a demon.”
Jesus*p did not say a word to her. His disciples approached him and urged him, “Send her away because she’s crying out after us.”
He*p replied, “I*r was*r sent*r only*r to*r the*r lost*r sheep*r of*r the*r house*r of*r Israel.”*r
But*p she came, knelt before him, and said, “Lord, help me!”
He*p answered, “It*r isn’t*r right*r to*r take*r the*r children’s*r bread*r and*r throw*r it*r to*r the*r dogs.”*r
“Yes,*p Lord,” she said, “yet even the dogs eat the crumbs that fall from their masters’ table.”
Then*p Jesus replied to her, “Woman,*r your*r faith*r is*r great.*r Let*r it*r be*r done*r for*r you*r as*r you*r want.”*r And from that moment her daughter was healed.
Healing Many People
Moving*p on from there, Jesus passed along the Sea of Galilee. He went up on a mountain and sat there,
and large crowds came to him, including the lame, the blind, the crippled, those unable to speak, and many others. They put them at his feet, and he healed them.
So the crowd was amazed when they saw those unable to speak talking, the crippled restored, the lame walking, and the blind seeing, and they gave glory to the God of Israel.
Feeding of the Four Thousand

Jesus*p called his disciples and said, “I*r have*r compassion*r on*r the*r crowd,*r because*r they’ve*r already*r stayed*r with*r me*r three*r days*r and*r have*r nothing*r to*r eat.*r I*r don’t*r want*r to*r send*r them*r away*r hungry,*r otherwise*r they*r might*r collapse*r on*r the*r way.”*r
The*p disciples said to him, “Where could we get enough bread in this desolate place to feed such a crowd?”
“How*rp many*r loaves*r do*r you*r have?”*r Jesus asked them. “Seven,”*p they said, “and a few small fish.”
After*p commanding the crowd to sit down on the ground,
he took the seven loaves and the fish, gave thanks, broke them, and gave them to the disciples, and the disciples gave them to the crowds.
They all ate and were satisfied. They collected the leftover pieces - seven large baskets full.
Now there were four thousand men who had eaten, besides women and children.
After dismissing the crowds, he got into the boat and went to the region of Magadan.
